sentences.sContent: Suddenly I felt a sharp pain in my shoulder.
sentences.sCn: 我突然感到肩部一阵剧痛。

sentences.sContent: I felt as if all my strength had gone.
sentences.sCn: 我觉得好象自己的力气已经全没了。

sentences.sContent: I felt like I was being kicked in the teeth every day.
sentences.sCn: 我感觉我好像每天都在经受挫折。

sentences.sContent: She felt his forehead. Perhaps he had a temperature.
sentences.sCn: 她摸了摸他的额头，他可能发烧了。

sentences.sContent: ...Many experts feel it is the wisest to walk up hill...
...Anyone interested or intend to inquire about please do not feel hesitated to contact Xiao Li...
...I definitely feel things more strongly than the average person...
...Some of us will seek it out; for others it will feel like an unwelcome intrusion into otherwise stable careers...
...And most of us may sometimes feel the frustration of having old memories interfere with new...
...It’s the stage in the middle of the journey when people feel youth vanishing...
...You feel the same emotions—it is just as raw...

...Team building skills are in short supply: Deloitte reports that only 12% of the executives they contacted feel they understand the way people work together in networks and only 21% feel confident in their ability to build cross-functional teams...
...One reason women may feel exhausted is that they have a hard time saying "no"...
...we should feel happy when we pursue knowledge for knowledge's sake...

phrases.pCn: 镇定；感觉很好；觉得身体正常
是什么滋味；是什么感觉；意味着什么
在家中般轻松自在；感觉自在

words.tran: 有感觉的；有同情心的；富于感情的
感动地，充满感情地；衷心地
感觉，触觉；感情，情绪；同情
[动] 触角；试探；试探者；厚薄规
感觉；认为（feel的现在分词）；触摸

trans.tranOther: to experience a particular physical feeling or emotion
